newsitem.title: JAPAN: BOJ says to watch money supply, asset prices.
newsitem.headline: BOJ says to watch money supply, asset prices.

text.p: Bank of Japan (BOJ) Governor Yasuo Matsushita told a parliamentary committee meeting on Wednesday that the BOJ would continue to pay attention to movements in asset prices and money supply in managing its monetary policy.
Matsushita told the Lower House of parliament's finance committee that the BOJ's monetary policy was aimed at achieving sustainable economic growth without inflation.
"It is necessary for us to take speedy measures (to achieve sustainable growth without inflation), while paying attention to movements in asset prices and money supply," he said.
The BOJ's monetary policy must not be used solely to correct foreign exchange rates or external imbalances, he added.
